text:
Can I somehow have the operation
```function multiply_test(a, b, c, d)
    mul!(a, b .+ c, d)
end

a = rand(500, 500)
b = rand(500, 500)
c = rand(500, 500)
d = rand(500, 500)
@btime multiply_test($a, $b, $c, $d)```
not allocate any space for `b.+c` ?

elements.text: Can I somehow have the operation

function multiply_test(a, b, c, d)
    mul!(a, b .+ c, d)
end

a = rand(500, 500)
b = rand(500, 500)
c = rand(500, 500)
d = rand(500, 500)
@btime multiply_test($a, $b, $c, $d)

text: is either of them allowed to be destroyed?

elements.text: is either of them allowed to be destroyed?

text: the result of the broadcast has to be materialized before it can be passed into `mul!`

elements.text: the result of the broadcast has to be materialized before it can be passed into

text:
no unfortunately they cannot be overwritten. The only alternative I could come up with is
```    mul!(a, b, d)
    mul!(a, c, d, 1, 1)```
but that is more costly than the allocation

elements.text: no unfortunately they cannot be overwritten. The only alternative I could come up with is

mul!(a, b, d)
    mul!(a, c, d, 1, 1)
but that is more costly than the allocation

text: would it be acceptable to pass a pre-allocated vector into `multiply_test` to store the intermediary result?
